ns1:Asset.ns1:name: MWS2R2 - CM2012 - Prereqs Primary
ns1:Asset.ns1:description: Delay count required as this script follows on from scripts that install Windows Features. Upon reboot Server Manager has to reinitialise.
ns1:Asset.ns1:body:
# Load Common functions . .\Logging.ps1 . .\GlobalRepository.ps1 . .\LaunchProcess.ps1 . .\FilesUtility.ps1 . .\PlatformUtils.ps1
# get current script location $scriptPath = split-path -parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition $scriptName = $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Name
ConfigureLogging $scriptPath $scriptName
######################################################################### # Main (Primary Server only) #########################################################################
#Use ArgList variable in Start-Process commands so embedded variables and env variables resolve #START.exe is used with msiexec otherwise it does not wait
$DomainFQDN = (get-globalvariable("Global\DomainFQDN")).value $DomainNetBIOS = (get-globalvariable("Global\DomainNetBIOS")).value $DomainDN = (get-globalvariable("AD\DistinguishedName")).value $ServiceAccountName = "$DomainNetBIOS\$env:CM_ServiceAccount" $ServiceAccountPwd = get-serviceAccountPassword -username $env:CM_ServiceAccount.ToLower() # Covert to lowercase as get-serviceAccountPassword function is case sensitive $SQLServerName = get-computername -ComponentID $env:SQL_ComponentID -InstanceID $env:SQL_InstanceID
If ($DomainFQDN -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $DomainFQDN not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($DomainNetBIOS -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $DomainNetBIOS not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($DomainDN -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $DomainDN not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($ServiceAccountName -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $ServiceAccountName not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($ServiceAccountPwd -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $ServiceAccountPwd not defined'; EXIT 1} If ($SQLServerName -eq $NULL) {Write-Host 'ERROR: $SQLServerName not defined'; EXIT 1}
Log "**** Starting: Primary Pre-Reqs Config... ****" Log "`n"
Log "Copy required content locally" # Will be copied to C:\Users\<profile> Get-AppFiles "PC Devices\Misc\SQL Server\SQL Server 2012 Exp x64 SP2" Log "`n"
Log "Check AD Group membership prereq..." $arglist = "/c Powershell.exe -Command `"& { If (!(Get-ADComputer $env:Computername -Properties MemberOf | Select -Expand Memberof | Select-String -Pattern 'ROLE-SCCM-Servers')) { EXIT 1} }`"" $ret = LaunchProcessAsUser $env:COMSPEC $arglist $ServiceAccountName $ServiceAccountPwd If ($ret -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: $env:computername is NOT a member of $DomainNetBIOS\ROLE-SCCM-Servers. Exiting..."; EXIT 1} Log "`n"
Log "ADK for Windows 8.1..." $arglist = "/features OptionID.DeploymentTools OptionID.WindowsPreinstallationEnvironment OptionID.UserStateMigrationTool /installpath C:\WindowsKits\8.1 /quiet /norestart /ceip off /log $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-ADK.log" Start-Process -NoNewWindow -Wait -FilePath "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\ADK for Win8.1\adksetup.exe" -ArgumentList $arglist Start-Sleep -Seconds 300 Log "`n"
Log "Installing Report Viewer 2012..." #Used for launching reports from CM2012 console Log " **Running CLR Types**" CMD /c Start /WAIT msiexec /i "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Microsoft Report Viewer\Microsoft Report Viewer 2012\SQLSysClrTypes.msi" /qn /norestart /log $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-ReportViewer_SQLSysClrTypes.log Start-Sleep -Seconds 30 Log " **Running Report Viewer MSI**" CMD /c Start /WAIT msiexec /i "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Microsoft Report Viewer\Microsoft Report Viewer 2012\ReportViewer.msi" /qn /norestart /log $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-ReportViewer_MSI.log Start-Sleep -Seconds 30 Log "`n"
Log "Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Report Builder..." CMD /c Start /WAIT msiexec /i "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Microsoft SQL Server Report Builder\Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Report Builder\ReportBuilder3.msi" /qn /norestart /log $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-ReportBuilder3.log Start-Sleep -Seconds 30 Log "`n"
Log "Installing Windows 2012 Roles (WSUS)..." Install-WindowsFeature -Name UpdateServices-Services,UpdateServices-DB -IncludeManagementTools -LogPath "$env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-Roles_WSUS.log" If ($LastExitCode -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: Failed to install WSUS Role. Exiting..."; EXIT 1} Log "`n" Start-Sleep -s 120
Log "Configure WSUS... (log file located under %windir%\tmpXXXX.tmp)" $arglist = "postinstall SQL_INSTANCE_NAME=$SQLServerName\$env:SQL_InstanceName CONTENT_DIR=F:\WSUS" # WSUS hosted on SQL box $ret = LaunchProcessAsUser "C:\Program Files\Update Services\Tools\wsusutil.exe" $arglist $ServiceAccountName $ServiceAccountPwd If ($ret -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: WSUS install failed"; EXIT 1} Log "`n" Start-Sleep -s 300
Log " **WSUS is using the following DB:" reg query "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Update Services\Server\Setup" /v SqlServerName Log "`n"
Log "Installing SCUP 2011..." CMD /c Start /WAIT MSIEXEC.exe /i "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Microsoft SCUP 2011\SystemCenterUpdatesPublisher.msi" /qn /norestart /log $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-SCUP.log
Log "Installing MDT 2013 v6.2.5019.0..." CMD /c Start /WAIT MSIEXEC.exe /i "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\MDT\MDT 2013 v6.2.5019.0\MicrosoftDeploymentToolkit2013_x64.msi" /qn /norestart /log $env:windir\Debug\ConfigMgr2012\$env:Computername\$env:computername-MDT.log Log "`n"
Log "Installing SQL Server 2012 Express SP2 - Management Studio ..." # Log files located in "C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\110\Setup Bootstrap\Log" Log " **Copying SQL data locally..." $CMDfile = "$ScriptPath\SQLManagementStudio_x64_ENU\_MS SQL 2012 Exp SP2 x64_MgtStudioOnly.cmd" (Get-Content $CMDfile) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "Set SQLSYSADMINACCOUNTS=.*" , "Set SQLSYSADMINACCOUNTS=`"NT AUTHORITY\System`" `"$DomainNetBIOS\PERM-L-SCCM-SQLAdmins`" `"$ServiceAccountName`"" } | Set-Content $CMDfile $arglist = "/c `"$CMDfile`"" Log " **Installing..." LaunchProcessAsUser $env:COMSPEC $arglist $ServiceAccountName $ServiceAccountPwd Log "`n" Start-Sleep -s 120
Log " ** Configuring SQL server OS and Database Delegation" # Needs to be run after SQL Server is installed so that 'SQL-Permissions' function can work $SQLServerName = (get-computername -ComponentID $env:SQL_ComponentID -InstanceID $env:SQL_InstanceID).ToUpper() $PS1File = "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr\Scripts\SQL-Server Config.ps1" # Add commands to PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "ScriptPath =.*" , "ScriptPath = `"$ScriptPath`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "SQLServerName =.*" , "SQLServerName = `"$SQLServerName`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "DomainFQDN =.*" , "DomainFQDN = `"$DomainFQDN`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File (Get-Content $PS1File) | ForEach-Object { $_ -replace "DomainNetBIOS =.*" , "DomainNetBIOS = `"$DomainNetBIOS`"" } | Set-Content $PS1File
# Run PS1 file using svc account credentials $ArgList = "/c Powershell -file `"$PS1File`"" $ret = LaunchProcessAsUser "$env:ComSpec" $ArgList $ServiceAccountName $ServiceAccountPwd # Needs to run %COMSPEC% as Powershell.exe was not found and is looking for absolute path If ($ret -ne 0) {Log "ERROR: SQL delegation failed"; EXIT 1} Log "`n"
Log "Create Source Repository to house content..." If (!(Test-Path "F:\ConfigMgr")) { Get-AppFiles "PC Devices\System Center\Ops Repository" $tmp = robocopy "$ScriptPath\ConfigMgr_Share" "F:\ConfigMgr" /move /s /e /r:5 /w:10 /np /njh } Else { Log "F:\ConfigMgr already exists. Please update manually if still required." }
Log "**** Finished: Primary Pre-Reqs Config... ****"
